title: Vance to meet Modi, Meloni during trip to India and Italy with wife Usha
summary: Vice President JD Vance and his wife Usha will embark on a diplomatic trip to Italy and India from Friday to April 24. The journey includes meetings with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as well as visits to Rome, New Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra. The trip holds special significance as Usha Vance is the daughter of South Indian immigrants.
content:
Vice President JD Vance and his family will travel to Italy and India this week and next to meet with leaders and visit cultural sites.

Vance's office announced Wednesday that his trip from Friday to April 24 will include visits to Rome and New Delhi along with the Indian cities of Jaipur and Agra.

The trip continues Vance's prominent role in White House foreign engagements, following his recent visits to Greenland last month and to Paris and Munich in February. President Donald Trump is scheduled to make his first foreign trip in May to Saudi Arabia.

In Rome, Vance will meet with Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, who is scheduled for a White House visit on Thursday. The Vice President, who converted to Catholicism in 2019, will also meet with Vatican Secretary of State Cardinal Pietro Parolin and participate in Easter Sunday ceremonies.

The India portion of the trip marks Vance's first visit to the country and carries special significance for the second family, as Vice President's wife Usha Vance is the daughter of South Indian immigrants. During the visit, Vance is expected to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who previously met with President Trump at the White House in February.

Vance’s office said Wednesday his trip from Friday to April 24 will include visits to Rome and New Delhi along with the Indian cities of Jaipur and Agra.

The trip comes as Vance has taken on a prime role in the White House’s engagements abroad. The Republican vice president and his wife, Usha Vance,traveled to Greenlandlast month, and hewent to Paris and Munichin February.

President Donald Trump is expected to make his first foreign trip in May to Saudi Arabia.

In Rome this week, Vance is expected to meet withPrime Minister Giorgia Meloni, who is due to visit the White House on Thursday. Vance, who converted to Catholicism in 2019, will also meet with Vatican Secretary of State Cardinal Pietro Parolin, according to his office, and is expected to participate in ceremonies around Easter Sunday.

Vance’s visit to India marks his first trip to the country, which has added significance for the second family.Usha Vanceis the daughter of immigrants from South India.

While in India next week, Vance is expected to meet with Prime MinisterNarendra Modi, who met with Trump at the White House in February.
